lead_paragraph: Since Tuesday, countries in southeastern Europe have moved to close the migrant trail, even as the European Union continues talks with Turkey.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matthew Brunwasser from Sofia, Bulgaria; Aleksandar Dimishkovski from Skopje, Macedonia; James Kanter from Brussels; and Joseph Orovic from Zadar, Croatia.

headline.print_headline: Balkan Nations Block Migrants’ Path to Europe
headline.main: Balkan Nations Shut Down March of Migrants

snippet: Since Tuesday, countries in southeastern Europe have moved to close the migrant trail, even as the European Union continues talks with Turkey.
abstract: Slovenia, Serbia, Croatia and Macedonia close their borders to new migrants, effectively shutting down route that migrants have been using to travel through southeastern Europe; move has implicit backing of European Union, which has struck deal with Turkey to reduce flow of migrants.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
